attributes.title: I'm Bullish On Hasbro
summary: Hasbro released third quarter earnings on 10/23/2017.
The Toys "R" Us bankruptcy had investors spooked and the stocked sold off after the earnings release.
Looking at earnings, you can see that almost every segment did very well on a year-over-year basis.
The company's innovation is superb and its merchandise portfolio is very popular and should do well this holiday season.
HAS has raised dividends for 14 consecutive years.

attributes.content:
In terms of sales, Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) is the second largest toy and leisure company in the world. Morningstar estimates that Hasbro controls more than 10% of the toy industry’s $25 billion in annual sales. The last time I looked at Hasbro was right before the company reported third quarter earnings. I am looking at the company again because games, toys and dolls are a popular gift to give during the holidays. Deloitte’s holiday survey showed that 39% of consumers plan to give games, toys and dolls as gifts this year, up from 29% in 2012. In that same survey, respondents told Deloitte that toys will consume almost 20% of holiday gift giving budgets. As I’ve said before, Hasbro’s brands and licensing agreements are very popular among shoppers. With popular brands and a large percentage of consumers expected to purchase toys this holiday season, Hasbro has an opportunity to continue to grow its sales. I've been bullish on Hasbro for some time. After reviewing the company's third quarter earnings report, I continue to think that Hasbro has a vast runway for growth. Let's take a look at the company to see why I think so.

3rd Quarter Results

Hasbro reported earnings on 10/23/2017. Earnings per share in the quarter came in at $2.05. This figured topped estimates by 11 cents. Revenue was strong in the quarter, growing 6.5% year over year to just under $1.8 billion. This was slightly above analysts' estimates by $10 million. Revenues grew 7% compared to Q3 2016. For the year, revenues are also up 7% from this time last year. U.S., Canada and International markets both saw 7% revenue growth.
